div.p: Box 1791, Williamson papers, La Trobe Australian Manuscripts Collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

This undated fragment is dated to late April 1894 on the basis of M's letter to Williamson, 19 April 1894 (in this edition as 94-04-19b), saying that he would welcome Algae.
It is very pleasing to me, dear Mr Williamson, that you will gather occasionally seaweeds for me. A little of each sort, merely dried on shelves will suffice after a storm, when the Algs are yet fresh and unbleached. Perhaps you are not a great distance from the nearest part of the coast.
